titleStmt.title: MS. Canon. Pat. Lat. 57
MSS. Canon. Pat. Lat. (Canonici Latin Patristic)

msDesc.head: Gregory the Great, De cura pastorali, with glosses in Latin and Old High German; southern Germany, c. 1100

msItem.author: Gregory the Great
msItem.title: De cura pastorali
msItem.note: Fol. 1r blank except for later pen-trials and erased ex libris; see Provenance. Part of the folio excised.

msItem.incipit: Antiqui moris fuit consuetudo que et usque hodie in romana ęcclesia quasi in lege tenetur, ab episcopis urbis Rauennę presidentibus, summum apostolicę sedis pontificem eligi
msItem.note: Followed by an erased text and a note in 15th-century (?) Italian script, mostly excised; see Provenance.

msItem.rubric: In nomine domini nostri Iesu Christi incipit liber regulę pastoralis sancti Gregorii papę scriptvs ad Iohannem episcopum
msItem.incipit: PASTORALIS CURĘ ME PONDERA FVGERE DElitiscendo uoluisse

msItem.rubric: Ne uenire imperiti ad magisterium audeant
Quanta debet esse diuersitas in arte predicationis
msItem.incipit: QUIA IGITUR QUALIS ESSE debeat pastor ostendimus
ALITER NAMQUE ADMONENDI SUNT VIRI atque aliter admonendę sunt feminę
msItem.explicit: per singula quanta possumus breuitate pandamus

msItem.incipit: (fol. 34r) ALITER IGITUR ADMONENDI SVNT VIRI atque aliter feminę. Quia illis [gloss: scilicet uiris] grauia

msItem.note: The text presented in two books, equivalent to books 1-2 and book 3 in the usual division. This manuscript not listed by Richard W. Clement, 'A handlist of manuscripts containing Gregory's Regula Pastoralis', Manuscripta 28 (1984), 33-44.

msItem.title: Glosses
msItem.note: As far as fol. 64v the Old High German glosses are in large part identical to those in Basel, UB B. V. 21 (Die Althochdeutschen Glossen, ed. E. Steinmeyer and E. Sievers, II (1882), 197-9, no. DCXL; BStK no. 26 [online], with literature).

supportDesc.collation: 1(8)-12(8) (fols. 1-95, including 50a, b). The third and sixth leaves in quires 5-8 are half-sheets (fols. 35, 38, 43, 46, 50b, 53, 58, 61) as are second and seventh in quire 12 (fols. 89, 94).

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in blind for 1 column of 30 lines. Ruled space 180 100

handDesc.handNote: Caroline minuscule by two hands, (a) fols. 1v-79v, 88r-95r, with frequent ligatures, (b) fols. 80r-87v (quire 11)

decoDesc.decoNote: Foliate initials in red at the beginning of each book, fols. 2r, 34r.

binding.p: Sewn on four bands (replacing earlier sewing using five stations); 16th century or 17th century (?), Italian (?) brown calf over pasteboards, blind-ruled and and blind-stamped with fleur-de-lis and leafwork motifs, and indistinct centrepieces, the Crucifixion on the front and perhaps the Virgin and Child or St Christopher on the back. The spine with gilt label 'S. Gregor. Papae Lib. Regul. Pastoral.' and 'Cod. Mem. 1150' (probably a date, rather than a shelfmark; cf. fol. 1r). Endleaves of 18th-century Venetian paper with three moons watermark.

history.provenance: Unidentified collegiate church: two erased ex libris inscriptions, fol. 1r, 'Iste liber est canonicorum ...'
Fol. 1r: pentrials, one with the year 1150.

Probably in Italy by the 15th century: inscription, mostly excised, in Italian script, fol. 1v: '... monasterii sanctę
a castelionibus
loco recepte ele
am discretam
us fuit annotatus'

recordHist.source:
Description by Matthew Holford, March 2021. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Catalogi codicum manuscriptorum Bibliothecæ Bodleianæ pars tertia codices Græcos et Latinos Canonicianos complectens, Quarto Catalogues III, 1854).
Quarto Catalogue, col. 323 Summary Catalogue, vol. 4, p. 327

listBibl.bibl: Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library Oxford, I (1966), no. 48 (as 'c. 1100')

revisionDesc.change: Revised description for Polonsky German digitization project.
